body: Pinging this issue. @rickeylev I noticed you've been making changes around the Python rules here. Would you be able to take a look? This issue is coming up more and more as more projects are upgraded to Bazel 6.

What is this "RUN_UNDER_RUNFILES" environment variable? Is there some doc about this? As near as I can tell it's only set when Bazel runs a target as a test?

Anyways, yeah, bug. I was able to repro.

Posterity/notes to self: This was PR #15590

issue.title: fix(python): remove temporary module space created for zip-based binaries

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
PR #15590 accidentally introduced a bug where zip-based binaries weren't cleaning up the temporary runfiles directory they extracted their zip into when they were run *outside* of a test invocation.

To fix, explicitly keep track of when the module space needs to be deleted or not, and pass that long to the code that decides how to execute the program and how to clean it up afterwards.

Fixes #17342

body: @rickeylev thank you for getting this done so quickly. Can you merge this into the Bazel 6.1 branch so that it can go out as soon as possible?
I suppose so. I've never done or requested a backport, so I'll have to ask around how to do that.
Hi all, can this wait till the next release (6.2)? We've already created the third release candidate for 6.1 and plan to do the final release on Monday, so we won't be able to include this.

Hi,

Yes, if it's too late for 6.1, then 6.2 is fine.

issue.title: [6.2.0] Zipapps no longer deleting Bazel.runfiles_* directories placed in /tmp

body:
I was seeing this on 6.3.2 and tried upgrading to 7.1.1 to see if it fixed it, but it still happens.

Anyone else still seeing this?
